Bamsoet Sebut Perubahan Konstitusi Bisa Mengantar Babak Baru Bangsa
05 Nov 2019, 21:53 by Alfi Kholisdinuka
Jakarta - Ketua MPR RI Bambang Soesatyo menilai para pendiri bangsa Indonesia sangat arif dan bijaksana dalam proses penyusunan undang-undang dasar, sehingga tidak melarang adanya amandemen yang dilakukan oleh generasi bangsa.
Mereka, kata Bamsoet, menyadari konstitusi secara alamiah akan terus berkembang sesuai dengan dinamika dan kebutuhan masyarakat. Mengingat tantangan yang dihadapi selalu berbeda dari satu generasi ke generasi selanjutnya.
"Dalam kerangka itulah pada tahun 1999 sampai 2002, MPR RI telah mewujudkan reformasi konstitusi Indonesia melalui perubahan Undang-Undang Dasar Negara Republik Indonesia Tahun 1945 (UUD NRI 1945)," ujarnya dalam keterangan tertulis, Selasa (5/11/2019).
"Perubahan tersebut telah mengantarkan bangsa Indonesia memasuki babak baru yang mengubah sejarah kehidupan bermasyarakat, berbangsa dan bernegara," imbuh Bamsoet saat menjadi Keynote Speech pada Seminar Nasional 'Refleksi 20 Tahun Pelaksanaan UUD NRI 1945' di Jakarta.
Bamsoet menjelaskan berbagai perubahan konstitusi telah memberikan landasan yang kuat dalam mendukung penegakan demokrasi dan hak asasi manusia. Namun demikian, keberhasilan reformasi konstitusi tidaklah menjamin apa yang dikehendaki oleh konstitusi dapat segera terwujud.
Karena pada tingkat implementasi dapat saja ditemukan kekurangan atau ketidaksesuaian, yang apabila dikaji justru bertentangan dengan nilai-nilai ideal yang terkandung dalam konstitusi.
"Misalnya, suksesnya pemilu serentak 2019 sebagai amanat UUD NRI 1945 Pasal 22E patut kita syukuri. Namun demikian, pemilu serentak 2019 masih menyisakan masalah, salah satunya polarisasi di dalam masyarakat. Banyaknya berita bohong, ujaran kebencian, saling hujat sesama anak bangsa, saling fitnah, persekusi di media sosial yang terus berlanjut sampai sekarang adalah contoh-contoh yang tidak sesuai dengan makna yang terkandung dalam konstitusi," jelasnya.
Contoh lainnya, pemilihan kepala daerah secara demokratis sebagaimana diatur di dalam Pasal 18 Ayat 4 UUD NRI 1945 dalam praktik hanya ditafsirkan pemilihan kepada daerah secara langsung. Hal ini menimbulkan besarnya biaya yang harus dikeluarkan melalui APBN atau APBD. Padahal, kondisi sosial masyarakat masih terjebak dalam kemiskinan dan kesenjangan.
"Politik uang yang marak terjadi dalam pemilihan kepala daerah juga telah menimbulkan moral hazard yang luas di masyarakat," tutur Bamsoet.
Tak heran, jika setelah 20 tahun berjalan sejak dilakukan amandemen pertama pada tahun 1999, kini mulai dirasakan masih ada ruang-ruang kosong dalam konstitusi. Mengingat penyelenggaraan kehidupan ketatanegaraan berjalan beriringan dengan dinamika perkembangan masyarakat.
"Ada berbagai pendapat. Pertama, ingin kembali ke UUD 1945 yang asli sesuai Dekrit Presiden 5 Juli 1959. Kedua, penyempurnaan melalui amandemen ke-5. Ketiga, perubahan menyeluruh UUD NRI 1945 yang telah empat kali dilakukan perubahan. Keempat, menghendaki perubahan terbatas dengan menghadirkan kembali GBHN. Dan kelima, pandangan yang menilai bahwa sistem ketatanegaraan kita pada saat ini sudah sesuai dengan kebutuhan masyarakat," papar Bamsoet.
Terhadap berbagai pandangan tersebut, Bendahara Umum DPP Partai Golkar 2014-2016 ini menerangkan, MPR RI mencoba menyikapinya dengan melakukan kajian secara cermat dan mendalam. Kalaupun pada akhirnya perlu dilakukan penataan sistem ketatanegaraan melalui perubahan kelima UUD NRI 1945, maka hakikat dari semangat pembentukan Undang-Undang Dasar oleh para pendiri bangsa harus tetap menjiwai rumusan perubahan kelima tersebut.
"Pasal 37 UUD NRI 1945 memang memberi kemungkinan adanya perubahan Undang-Undang Dasar. Akan tetapi, perubahan konstitusi tidaklah dapat dilakukan tanpa adanya kehendak dari rakyat selaku pemilik kedaulatan itu sendiri. Sehingga untuk mengubahnya harus digunakan cara yang khusus dan prosedur yang lebih ketat apabila dibandingkan dengan prosedur untuk mengubah undang-undang," pungkasnya.

(ujm/ega)

Bamsoet Call Changes to the Constitution Can Lead the New Round of the Nation
05 Nov 2019, 21:53 by Alfi Kholisdinuka
Jakarta - Indonesian MPR Chair Bambang Soesatyo assesses the founders of the Indonesian nation to be very wise and prudent in the process of drafting a constitution, so that it does not prohibit amendments carried out by the nation's generation.
They, said Bamsoet, realize that the constitution will naturally continue to develop in accordance with the dynamics and needs of the community. Given the challenges they face are always different from one generation to the next.
"Within that framework from 1999 to 2002, the Indonesian MPR has implemented Indonesian constitutional reform through amending the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia (1945 Constitution)," he said in a written statement on Tuesday (11/05/2019).
"These changes have brought the Indonesian nation into a new phase that has changed the history of community, nation and state life," added Bamsoet when he became the Keynote Speech at the National Seminar 'Reflection on 20 Years of the Implementation of the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia' in Jakarta.
Bamsoet explained that various changes to the constitution had provided a strong foundation in supporting the upholding of democracy and human rights. However, the success of constitutional reform does not guarantee that what the constitution wants can be realized immediately.
Because at the implementation level it can be found deficiencies or discrepancies, which when examined actually conflict with the ideal values contained in the constitution.
"For example, the success of the 2019 concurrent elections as mandated by the 1945 Constitution of the NRI 1945 Article 22 should be grateful for us. However, the simultaneous elections in 2019 still have problems, one of which is polarization in society. "Persecution on social media that continues today is examples that do not fit the meaning contained in the constitution," he explained.
Another example, democratic regional head elections as regulated in Article 18 Paragraph 4 of the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia in practice are only interpreted as direct elections to regions. This raises the amount of costs that must be incurred through the state budget or regional budget. In fact, the social conditions of society are still trapped in poverty and inequality.
"Money politics that is rife in regional elections has also created widespread moral hazard in the community," Bamsoet said.
No wonder, if after 20 years since the first amendment was carried out in 1999, it is now starting to feel there are still empty spaces in the constitution. Given the implementation of state administration goes hand in hand with the dynamics of community development.
"There are various opinions. First, we want to return to the original 1945 Constitution according to the Presidential Decree of July 5, 1959. Second, improvement through the 5th amendment. Third, a comprehensive change to the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia which has been amended four times. Fourth, it requires limited changes with "Bringing back the GBHN. And fifth, a view that assesses that our current state administration system is in accordance with the needs of the community," Bamsoet explained.
Against these various views, the General Treasurer of the 2014-2016 Golkar Party DPP explained that the MPR RI tried to react to this by conducting a careful and in-depth study. Even if in the end it is necessary to restructure the constitutional system through the fifth amendment to the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia, then the essence of the spirit of the formation of the Constitution by the founders of the nation must continue to animate the formulation of the fifth amendment.
"Article 37 of the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia does indeed provide the possibility of changes to the Constitution. However, changes to the constitution cannot be carried out without the will of the people as the owner of the sovereignty itself. Therefore, special methods and stricter procedures must be used to change them. with a procedure for changing the law, "he concluded.
